Title: "Configuring Azure Search Index and Field Mapping for MySQL Data"
Text:
C:\Users\adamh\Downloads\azure-search.pdfSet dataDeletionDetectionPolicy if you want to remove search documents from asearch index when the source item is deleted.In a search index, add search index fields that correspond to the fields in your table.Create or Update Index specifies the fields:HTTP    },     "container" : {          "name" : "[TableName]"      },     "dataChangeDetectionPolicy" : {          "@odata.
type": "#Microsoft.Azure.Search.HighWaterMarkChangeDetectionPolicy",         "highWaterMarkColumnName": "[HighWaterMarkColumn]"     } } Add search fields to an index{     "name" : "hotels-mysql-ix",     "fields": [         { "name": "ID", "type": "Edm.
String", "key": true, "searchable": false },         { "name": "HotelName", "type": "Edm.String", "searchable": true, "filterable": false },         { "name": "Category", "type": "Edm.String", "searchable": false, "filterable": true, "sortable": true  },         { "name": "City", "type": "Edm.String", "searchable": false, "filterable": true, "sortable": true },         { "name": "Description", "type": "Edm.
String", "searchable": false, "filterable": false, "sortable": false  }          ] If the primary key in the source table matches the document key (in this case, "ID"), theindexer imports the primary key as the document key.The following table maps the MySQL database to Cognitive Search equivalents. Formore information, see Supported data types (Azure Cognitive Search).MySQL data typesCognitive Search field typesbool, booleanEdm.Boolean, Edm.Stringtinyint, smallint, mediumint, int, integer, yearEdm.Int32, Edm.Int64,Edm.StringbigintEdm.Int64, Edm.Stringfloat, double, realEdm.Double, Edm.Stringdate, datetime, timestampEdm.DateTimeOffset,Edm.
